title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Tuesday, 19 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: delia smith 's nephew to replace stephen fry on norwich city board .
norwich aviation academy to 'address nationwide skills shortage ' .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us on norfolk live today .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all the news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the county .
we 'd like to hear from you , so get in touch if you have a story or maybe a photograph that you 'd like to share with us .
you can contact us in the usual way , on email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: minister says more than £ 140m is needed to sort sink estates
text: the housing minister , and great yarmouth mp has said more than £ 140m will be needed to sort out problem housing estates .
brandon lewis said this initial funding will be used across the county to help councils , community groups and housing associations work out future plans for their housing .
more money will then be needed to make the changes .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich city sign naismith
text: norwich city have signed everton midfielder steven naismith for an undisclosed fee on a three-and-a-half-year deal .
the scottish international becomes the fifth player to sign for the canaries on a permanent basis so far this month ,
norwich city chief executive david mcnally told bbc radio norfolk : `` we were in pole position for his services , so were thrilled to have won the race . ''
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : feeling much colder than of late
text: it will be mainly dry overnight , with a few isolated wintry showers possible .
weather has your local forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: new face on the norwich board of directors
text: tom smith has joined the board of norwich city football club , in the seat vacated by stephen fry .
he 's the nephew of delia smith and michael wynn-jones , the joint majority shareholders .
author: Tom Williams
BBC Look East sport

documents.title: school to meet to decide how to improve standards
text: staff at a school that 's been put into special measures are meeting tonight to work out how to improve standards .
the executive headteacher of acle academy , gerard batty , says the latest ofsted report `` does n't make good reading '' .
the school was criticised for teaching standards and management .
the governors should put their hands up .
anyone who knew what was happening should have whistleblown . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: ed balls sets out norwich vision
text: it 's a busy time at norwich city football club , with stephen fry stepping down from the board .
today , chairman ed balls has been speaking about what he wants to achieve in his new role .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : `` inadequate '' norfolk high school put into special measures woman is sexually assaulted in the north of norwich
text: the main news stories this evening :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: apology after ambulance wait ordeal
text: today 's norwich evening news front page :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: academy 'has a lot of work to do '
text: the executive head teacher of a school that 's been put into special measures says he 's confident improvements are being made .
acle academy had previously been rated as good , but a recent inspection by ofsted highlighted a number of failings .
there are green shoots of recovery in the report .
the school has hit its low , it 's beginning to move out and there 's a lot of work to do . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: acting headteacher 'understands strengths and weaknesses ' of academy
text: an ofsted inspection of acle academy in december reported that leaders , including governors , had n't done enough about the decline in the quality of teaching and they did n't have the capacity to bring about necessary changes .
the inspectors also found achievement in key subjects to be low and not improving quickly enough .
but the report says there are `` pockets of effective teaching '' and a `` highly determined '' acting headteacher , who understands the strengths and weaknesses of the academy .
the school has been placed in special measures .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich woman dials 999 after taking energy drinks
text: the east of england ambulance service is asking people to treat the 999 service with respect , following a number of abusive and inappropriate calls .
in the past month , it 's received a number of inappropriate calls , including one from a woman in norwich who panicked after drinking two energy drinks .
one call handler was sworn at 15 times in four minutes by a man who 'd called about a genuine medical emergency .
elsewhere , a man in north cambridgeshire needed assistance with his passport , while a woman from essex asked for help cleaning her toilet .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: marham jets 'destroy is targets '
text: raf marham 's fighter jets have carried out a further strike in syria , using the hi-tech brimstone missiles to attack so-called islamic state targets .
tornado gr4s used the missiles to destroy a vehicle in tabbaqah in syria , and a terrorist supply truck in iraq , the ministry of defence said .
last week an is barracks near raqqa , the extremists ' stronghold in syria , was struck by tornado jets .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new home for stranded octopus
text: an octopus found stranded on heacham beach has been given a luxurious new home at hunstanton sea life sanctuary .
if human scrutiny becomes too much , the eight-legged cephalopod will be able to disappear into the hidey-holes and nooks and crannies of its display tank .
more commonly found around scotland and the west coast of the uk , the lesser octopus was one of two left high and dry on neighbouring beaches in mid-december .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : staying cold and dry
text: it will be staying cold and dry today , with light winds .
a cloudy night will follow , with a risk of freezing fog patches early tomorrow .
weather has more details for you .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: taking selfies with seals spells danger , expert warns
text: people going right up to seal pups and mothers on a norfolk beach to take selfies are putting themselves and the animals at risk , an expert has told me .
peter ansell , chairman of the friends of horsey seals group , said it is dangerous as the mothers can bite and become very aggressive if they believe the pups are threatened .

he added that the mothers will also abandon their young pups if they feel threatened themselves , meaning the young animals will die of starvation because they need their mother 's milk for nearly a month after birth .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: headlines : high school placed in 'special measures ' stephen fry steps down from norwich city board
text: the stories in the news this lunchtime :

documents.title: travel : three-vehicle accident on a47
text: the a1042 yarmouth road in thorpe st andrew is blocked , with traffic queuing in both directions between the a47 and a1242 junctions .
it follows an accident between three vehicles .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: how cold was it yesterday where you live ?
text: as dan holley shows , for many yesterday it was the coldest it had been since last january .
east anglia : -6.0c at writtle was the lowest in the region last night ' for many the coldest night since january 2015
@ twitterid just had an evening storm here in perth western australia .
two days in the mid 20 's .
very unusual .
@ twitterid very jealous !
@ twitterid @ twitterid you need to visit australia dan .
@ twitterid wellingborough temperature last night
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: travel : a1101 reopens
text: the a1101 welney causeway has reopened in both directions .
as this shows , the road had been closed for more than a week because of flooding .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: elderly couple lose phone and internet for nearly two months
text: an elderly couple from north norfolk say they have racked up mobile phone debts of £ 200 since their landline phone was cut off by a fault on 1 december .
plusnet , which provides phone and internet services to 84-year-old john marks and his wife in beeston regis , has told the couple the service will be back on by 25 january .
the company said the repair required more specialised works because of utility cables near to the fault .
it has apologised to the couple and promised to reimburse them .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: high school put into special measures
text: a school has been placed in special measures after an `` inadequate '' ofsted report .

when inspectors visited acle academy at the beginning of december , they found standards to be `` inadequate '' in a number of areas and said not enough had been done to address the decline in the quality of teaching .
the school had been rated as `` good '' two years ago .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ex-canary 's role in klose deal
text: today 's norwich evening news back page .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: stephen fry 'happy to relinquish ' board seat to become ambassador
text: actor , writer and television presenter stephen fry has stepped down from the board of norwich city football club , having held the role since 2010 .
fry , who has a home in norfolk and is a lifelong fan of the canaries , will continue to support the club as a norwich city ambassador .
he said : `` now i 'm so happy to relinquish my seat on the board .
to engage as fully as i can in the role of ambassador for norwich city .
we have so much to proud of , both on and off the pitch .
on the ball , city ! ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: wayne hemingway part of housing design team
text: we heard earlier from the designer wayne hemingway , who says the government 's promise of £ 140m to replace britain 's most run-down council estates wo n't be enough to tackle the problem .
he was in king 's lynn to see the completion of the second phase of the revamp of hillington square .
mr hemingway and his wife geraldine are part of the design team for freebridge community housing , which is spending £ 30m on the run-down 1960s complex , giving it a new lease of life .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: health line targets missed
text: today 's eastern daily press front page :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: rebuilding troubled housing estates 'is n't enough '
text: a community leader in norwich says £ 140m of government money to rebuild some of the country 's most troubled housing estates is n't enough .
steve burnham , the former head of the community association on the mile cross estate in norwich , says it wo n't necessarily improve things .
you have to get the community working and get them involved in things and find something for youngsters to do . ''

documents.title: aviation academy 'to address skills shortage '
text: mps have been told that a new training centre at norwich airport will play an important role in addressing a nationwide skills shortage in the aviation industry .
the norwich aviation academy will be the only place in the country to offer a specialised degree in aviation engineering .
simon witts , the head of the aviation skills partnership , says each year the new academy will turn out 80 engineers who are `` able to go straight into jobs with the world 's airlines '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wayne hemingway : money to rebuild estates 'a speck in the ocean '
text: the designer wayne hemingway says the government 's plans to improve council estates is a good start , but more is needed .
he was speaking at the official launch of the latest stage of the revamp of hillington square in king 's lynn last night .
hemingway ( right ) says there is a national housing need , but the government 's £ 140m wo n't go very far `` considering the first two phases of the hillington square makeover cost £ 12m '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: walsh brothers making big plans for 2016
text: cromer 's boxing twins liam and ryan walsh are targetting a place in the spotlight this year .

ryan defends his british featherweight title against darren traynor at the york hall bethnel green on friday night , while liam is british super featherweight champion and will make his return after a hand operation in the spring .
liam ( right ) told me : `` if i 'm not a world champion by the end of 2016 i 'll be disappointed . ''
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: patients 'kept out of a & e thanks to 999 trial '
text: the ambulance service says it managed to keep hundreds of people out of accident and emergency last month , thanks to a trial which has seen doctors working in the 999 control room .
the doctors have been giving ambulance crews additional advice over the phone , as part of the trial which started in july .
the east of england ambulance trust says the support service was used more than 1,500 times in december , with 85 % of cases resulting in alternatives to a & e admissions being found .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: delia 's nephew joins norwich city board
text: stephen fry is stepping down from norwich city 's board of directors and will be replaced by thomas smith , the nephew of delia smith .
the 35-year old is described by the club as a `` lifelong fan '' and is often seen at games sitting alongside his aunt and uncle , who are the canaries ' joint majority shareholders .
stephen fry becomes an ambassador of the club .
his filming commitments made it difficult for him to attend board meetings .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : a cold day with some sleet showers
text: a very cold and cloudy day , with light rain or sleet showers .
temperatures reaching 3c ( 37f ) .
a widespread frost will develop overnight , with a minimum temperature of 0c ( 32f ) .
weather has more information for you .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hello and welcome to norfolk live
text: thanks for joining us for tuesday 's norfolk live .
we 'll have the news , sport , travel and weather updates from across the county from now until 18:00 .
if you 've got a story or a photograph that you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
